intro: Enicosanthum erianthoides, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage and bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a distinctive and resilient species in its native environment.
